intro: Icosinia paniculata, commonly known as the panicled icosinia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in paniculate inflorescences, which are branched clusters that give it its common name. Icosinia paniculata typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and savannas. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and a subject of interest in ecological studies.
